--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, BarbaraSheridan <bsher213@b...> wrote:
> For those of you who've seen this. Does Jo Odagiri have a large 
part in it?
> 

If you see this movie only for Odagiri for an aim, it may very be 
tedium the first half of a movie. Furthermore, you will be irritated 
by the childishness of the heroine's words if you can understand 
Japanese. 
But I think that Odagiri's performance is comparatively good. 
What he is playing is the samurai who likes the murder of the name 
of Bijyomaru. Incidentally the portion of "Bijyo" in a name means a 
beautiful woman.  
He wears a pure white kimono, speaks about the words which a woman 
uses, and does feminine behavior. 
Although he does not seem to be a homosexual, he is surrounded by 
hooligans and receives indecent word. ^^;;;
The fight of a sword is also comparatively good. 
However, as I wrote before, to those who like a legitimate classic 
sword fight play, it is disreputable. 

momoiro-usagi
